verses.verse: And he heard<WH8085> <WH853> the words<WH1697> of Laban's<WH3837> sons,<WH1121> saying,<WH559> Jacob<WH3290> hath taken away<WH3947> <WH853> all<WH3605> that<WH834> was our father's;<WH1> and of that which<WH4480> <WH834> was our father's<WH1> hath he gotten<WH6213> <WH853> all<WH3605> this<WH2088> glory.<WH3519>
And Jacob<WH3290> beheld<WH7200> <WH853> the countenance<WH6440> of Laban,<WH3837> and, behold,<WH2009> it was not<WH369> toward<WH5973> him as before.<WH8543> <WH8032>
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Jacob,<WH3290> Return<WH7725> unto<WH413> the land<WH776> of thy fathers,<WH1> and to thy kindred;<WH4138> and I will be<WH1961> with<WH5973> thee.
And Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Rachel<WH7354> and Leah<WH3812> to the field<WH7704> unto<WH413> his flock,<WH6629>

And said<WH559> unto them, I<WH595> see<WH7200> <WH853> your father's<WH1> countenance,<WH6440> that<WH3588> it is not<WH369> toward<WH413> me as before;<WH8543> <WH8032> but the God<WH430> of my father<WH1> hath been<WH1961> with<WH5973> me.
And ye<WH859> know<WH3045> that<WH3588> with all<WH3605> my power<WH3581> I have served<WH5647> <WH853> your father.<WH1>
And your father<WH1> hath deceived<WH2048> me, and changed<WH2498> <WH853> my wages<WH4909> ten<WH6235> times;<WH4489> but God<WH430> suffered<WH5414> him not<WH3808> to hurt<WH7489> <WH5978> me.

If <WH518> he said<WH559> thus,<WH3541> The speckled<WH5348> shall be<WH1961> thy wages;<WH7939> then all<WH3605> the cattle<WH6629> bore<WH3205> speckled:<WH5348> and if<WH518> he said<WH559> thus,<WH3541> The ringstreaked<WH6124> shall be<WH1961> thy hire;<WH7939> then bore<WH3205> all<WH3605> the cattle<WH6629> ringstreaked.<WH6124>
Thus God<WH430> hath taken away<WH5337> <WH853> the cattle<WH4735> of your father,<WH1> and given<WH5414> them to me.

And it came to pass<WH1961> at the time<WH6256> that the cattle<WH6629> conceived,<WH3179> that I lifted up<WH5375> mine eyes,<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> in a dream,<WH2472> and, behold,<WH2009> the rams<WH6260> which leaped<WH5927> upon<WH5921> the cattle<WH6629> were ringstreaked,<WH6124> speckled,<WH5348> and grizzled.<WH1261>
And the angel<WH4397> of God<WH430> spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> me in a dream,<WH2472> saying, Jacob:<WH3290> And I said,<WH559> Here<WH2009> am I.

And he said,<WH559> Lift up<WH5375> now<WH4994> thine eyes,<WH5869> and see,<WH7200> all<WH3605> the rams<WH6260> which leap<WH5927> upon<WH5921> the cattle<WH6629> are ringstreaked,<WH6124> speckled,<WH5348> and grizzled:<WH1261> for<WH3588> I have seen<WH7200> <WH853> all<WH3605> that<WH834> Laban<WH3837> doeth<WH6213> unto thee.

I <WH595> am the God<WH410> of Bethel,<WH1008> where<WH834> <WH8033> thou anointedst<WH4886> the pillar,<WH4676> and where<WH834> <WH8033> thou vowedst<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto me: now<WH6258> arise,<WH6965> get thee out<WH3318> from<WH4480> this<WH2063> land,<WH776> and return<WH7725> unto<WH413> the land<WH776> of thy kindred.<WH4138>
And Rachel<WH7354> and Leah<WH3812> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto him, Is there yet<WH5750> any portion<WH2506> or inheritance<WH5159> for us in our father's<WH1> house?<WH1004>
Are we not<WH3808> counted<WH2803> of him strangers?<WH5237> for<WH3588> he hath sold<WH4376> us, and hath quite devoured<WH398> <WH398> also<WH1571> <WH853> our money.<WH3701>

For <WH3588> all<WH3605> the riches<WH6239> which<WH834> God<WH430> hath taken<WH5337> from our father,<WH4480> <WH1> that<WH1931> is ours, and our children's:<WH1121> now<WH6258> then, whatsoever<WH3605> <WH834> God<WH430> hath said<WH559> unto<WH413> thee, do.<WH6213>
Then Jacob<WH3290> rose up,<WH6965> and set<WH5375> <WH853> his sons<WH1121> and his wives<WH802> upon<WH5921> camels;<WH1581>

And he carried away<WH5090> <WH853> all<WH3605> his cattle,<WH4735> and all<WH3605> his goods<WH7399> which<WH834> he had gotten,<WH7408> the cattle<WH4735> of his getting,<WH7075> which<WH834> he had gotten<WH7408> in Padan-aram,<WH6307> for to go<WH935> to<WH413> Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>
And Laban<WH3837> went<WH1980> to shear<WH1494> <WH853> his sheep:<WH6629> and Rachel<WH7354> had stolen<WH1589> <WH853> the images<WH8655> that<WH834> were her father's.<WH1>
And Jacob<WH3290> stole away<WH1589> <WH853> unawares<WH3820> to Laban<WH3837> the Syrian,<WH761> in that<WH5921> he told<WH5046> him not<WH1097> that<WH3588> he<WH1931> fled.<WH1272>

So he<WH1931> fled<WH1272> with all<WH3605> that<WH834> he had; and he rose up,<WH6965> and passed over<WH5674> <WH853> the river,<WH5104> and set<WH7760> <WH853> his face<WH6440> toward the mount<WH2022> Gilead.<WH1568>
And it was told<WH5046> Laban<WH3837> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117> that<WH3588> Jacob<WH3290> was fled.<WH1272>

And he took<WH3947> <WH853> his brethren<WH251> with<WH5973> him, and pursued<WH7291> after<WH310> him seven<WH7651> days'<WH3117> journey;<WH1870> and they overtook<WH1692> him in the mount<WH2022> Gilead.<WH1568>

And God<WH430> came<WH935> to<WH413> Laban<WH3837> the Syrian<WH761> in a dream<WH2472> by night,<WH3915> and said<WH559> unto him, Take heed<WH8104> that<WH6435> thou speak<WH1696> not to<WH5973> Jacob<WH3290> either good<WH4480> <WH2896> or<WH5704> bad.<WH7451>

Then Laban<WH3837> overtook<WH5381> <WH853> Jacob.<WH3290> Now Jacob<WH3290> had pitched<WH8628> <WH853> his tent<WH168> in the mount:<WH2022> and Laban<WH3837> with<WH854> his brethren<WH251> pitched<WH8628> in the mount<WH2022> of Gilead.<WH1568>

And Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> What<WH4100> hast thou done,<WH6213> that thou hast stolen away<WH1589> <WH853> unawares<WH3824> to me, and carried away<WH5090> <WH853> my daughters,<WH1323> as captives<WH7617> taken with the sword?<WH2719>

Wherefore <WH4100> didst thou flee away<WH2244> secretly,<WH1272> and steal away<WH1589> from me; and didst not<WH3808> tell<WH5046> me, that I might have sent thee away<WH7971> with mirth,<WH8057> and with songs,<WH7892> with tabret,<WH8596> and with harp?<WH3658>
And hast not<WH3808> suffered<WH5203> me to kiss<WH5401> my sons<WH1121> and my daughters?<WH1323> thou hast now<WH6258> done foolishly<WH5528> in so doing.<WH6213>

It is<WH3426> in the power<WH410> of my hand<WH3027> to do<WH6213> you hurt:<WH7451> but the God<WH430> of your father<WH1> spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> me last night,<WH570> saying,<WH559> Take thou heed<WH8104> that thou speak<WH4480> <WH1696> not to<WH5973> Jacob<WH3290> either good<WH4480> <WH2896> or<WH5704> bad.<WH7451>

And now,<WH6258> though thou wouldest needs be gone,<WH1980> <WH1980> because<WH3588> thou sore longedst<WH3700> <WH3700> after thy father's<WH1> house,<WH1004> yet wherefore<WH4100> hast thou stolen<WH1589> <WH853> my gods?<WH430>

And Jacob<WH3290> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Laban,<WH3837> Because<WH3588> I was afraid:<WH3372> for<WH3588> I said,<WH559> Peradventure<WH6435> thou wouldest take by force<WH1497> <WH853> thy daughters<WH1323> from<WH4480> <WH5973> me.

With <WH5973> whomsoever<WH834> thou findest<WH4672> <WH853> thy gods,<WH430> let him not<WH3808> live:<WH2421> before<WH5048> our brethren<WH251> discern<WH5234> thou what<WH4100> is thine with<WH5973> me, and take<WH3947> it to thee. For Jacob<WH3290> knew<WH3045> not<WH3808> that<WH3588> Rachel<WH7354> had stolen<WH1589> them.

And Laban<WH3837> went<WH935> into Jacob's<WH3290> tent,<WH168> and into Leah's<WH3812> tent,<WH168> and into the two<WH8147> maidservants'<WH519> tents;<WH168> but he found<WH4672> them not.<WH3808> Then went<WH3318> he out of Leah's tent,<WH4480> <WH168> <WH3812> and entered<WH935> into Rachel's<WH7354> tent.<WH168>

Now Rachel<WH7354> had taken<WH3947> <WH853> the images,<WH8655> and put<WH7760> them in the camel's<WH1581> furniture,<WH3733> and sat<WH3427> upon<WH5921> them. And Laban<WH3837> searched<WH4959> <WH853> all<WH3605> the tent,<WH168> but found<WH4672> them not.<WH3808>

And she said<WH559> to<WH413> her father,<WH1> Let it not<WH408> displease<WH2734> <WH5869> my lord<WH113> that<WH3588> I cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> rise up<WH6965> before<WH4480> <WH6440> thee; for<WH3588> the custom<WH1870> of women<WH802> is upon me. And he searched,<WH2664> but found<WH4672> not<WH3808> <WH853> the images.<WH8655>

And Jacob<WH3290> was wroth,<WH2734> and chided<WH7378> with Laban:<WH3837> and Jacob<WH3290> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Laban,<WH3837> What<WH4100> is my trespass?<WH6588> what<WH4100> is my sin,<WH2403> that<WH3588> thou hast so hotly pursued<WH1814> after<WH310> me?

Whereas <WH3588> thou hast searched<WH4959> <WH853> all<WH3605> my stuff,<WH3627> what<WH4100> hast thou found<WH4672> of all<WH4480> <WH3605> thy household<WH1004> stuff?<WH3627> set<WH7760> it here<WH3541> before<WH5048> my brethren<WH251> and thy brethren,<WH251> that they may judge<WH3198> between<WH996> us both.<WH8147>

This <WH2088> twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> have I<WH595> been with<WH5973> thee; thy ewes<WH7353> and thy she goats<WH5795> have not<WH3808> cast their young,<WH7921> and the rams<WH352> of thy flock<WH6629> have I not<WH3808> eaten.<WH398>

That which was torn<WH2966> of beasts I brought<WH935> not<WH3808> unto<WH413> thee; I<WH595> bore the loss<WH2398> of it; of my hand<WH4480> <WH3027> didst thou require<WH1245> it, whether stolen<WH1589> by day,<WH3117> or stolen<WH1589> by night.<WH3915>
Thus I was;<WH1961> in the day<WH3117> the drought<WH2721> consumed<WH398> me, and the frost<WH7140> by night;<WH3915> and my sleep<WH8142> departed<WH5074> from mine eyes.<WH4480> <WH5869>

Thus <WH2088> have I been twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> in thy house;<WH1004> I served<WH5647> thee fourteen<WH702> <WH6240> years<WH8141> for thy two<WH8147> daughters,<WH1323> and six<WH8337> years<WH8141> for thy cattle:<WH6629> and thou hast changed<WH2498> <WH853> my wages<WH4909> ten<WH6235> times.<WH4489>

Except <WH3884> the God<WH430> of my father,<WH1> the God<WH430> of Abraham,<WH85> and the fear<WH6343> of Isaac,<WH3327> had been<WH1961> with me, surely<WH3588> thou hadst sent me away<WH7971> now<WH6258> empty.<WH7387> God<WH430> hath seen<WH7200> <WH853> mine affliction<WH6040> and the labor<WH3018> of my hands,<WH3709> and rebuked<WH3198> thee last night.<WH570>

And Laban<WH3837> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto<WH413> Jacob,<WH3290> These daughters<WH1323> are my daughters,<WH1323> and these children<WH1121> are my children,<WH1121> and these cattle<WH6629> are my cattle,<WH6629> and all<WH3605> that<WH834> thou<WH859> seest<WH7200> is mine: and what<WH4100> can I do<WH6213> this day<WH3117> unto these<WH428> my daughters,<WH1323> or<WH176> unto their children<WH1121> which<WH834> they have born?<WH3205>
Now <WH6258> therefore come<WH1980> thou, let us make<WH3772> a covenant,<WH1285> I<WH589> and thou;<WH859> and let it be<WH1961> for a witness<WH5707> between<WH996> me and thee.
And Jacob<WH3290> took<WH3947> a stone,<WH68> and set it up<WH7311> for a pillar.<WH4676>

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto his brethren,<WH251> Gather<WH3950> stones;<WH68> and they took<WH3947> stones,<WH68> and made<WH6213> an heap:<WH1530> and they did eat<WH398> there<WH8033> upon<WH5921> the heap.<WH1530>
And Laban<WH3837> called<WH7121> it Jegar-sahadutha:<WH3026> but Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> it Galeed.<WH1567>

And Laban<WH3837> said,<WH559> This<WH2088> heap<WH1530> is a witness<WH5707> between<WH996> me and thee this day.<WH3117> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> was the name<WH8034> of it called<WH7121> Galeed;<WH1567>
And Mizpah;<WH4709> for<WH834> he said,<WH559> The LORD<WH3068> watch<WH6822> between<WH996> me and thee, when<WH3588> we are absent<WH5641> one<WH376> from another.<WH4480> <WH7453>

If <WH518> thou shalt afflict<WH6031> <WH853> my daughters,<WH1323> or if<WH518> thou shalt take<WH3947> other wives<WH802> beside<WH5921> my daughters,<WH1323> no<WH369> man<WH376> is with<WH5973> us; see,<WH7200> God<WH430> is witness<WH5707> between<WH996> me and thee.
And Laban<WH3837> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> Behold<WH2009> this<WH2088> heap,<WH1530> and behold<WH2009> this pillar,<WH4676> which<WH834> I have cast<WH3384> between<WH996> me and thee;

This <WH2088> heap<WH1530> be witness,<WH5707> and this pillar<WH4676> be witness,<WH5713> that<WH518> I<WH589> will not<WH3808> pass over<WH5674> <WH853> this<WH2088> heap<WH1530> to<WH413> thee, and that<WH518> thou<WH859> shalt not<WH3808> pass over<WH5674> <WH853> this<WH2088> heap<WH1530> and this<WH2063> pillar<WH4676> unto<WH413> me, for harm.<WH7451>

The God<WH430> of Abraham,<WH85> and the God<WH430> of Nahor,<WH5152> the God<WH430> of their father,<WH1> judge<WH8199> between<WH996> us. And Jacob<WH3290> swore<WH7650> by the fear<WH6343> of his father<WH1> Isaac.<WH3327>

Then Jacob<WH3290> offered<WH2076> sacrifice<WH2077> upon the mount,<WH2022> and called<WH7121> his brethren<WH251> to eat<WH398> bread:<WH3899> and they did eat<WH398> bread,<WH3899> and tarried all night<WH3885> in the mount.<WH2022>

And early in the morning<WH1242> Laban<WH3837> rose up,<WH7925> and kissed<WH5401> his sons<WH1121> and his daughters,<WH1323> and blessed<WH1288> them: and Laban<WH3837> departed,<WH1980> and returned<WH7725> unto his place.<WH4725>
